name: Berimbau Cordas/Arming Cords - Set of Three
description: Set of Three - replacement cordas for the berimbau.  Made of tempered steel wire with hand-twisted cotton lashing cord. Wire/Arame between 68 and 71 inches in length. Cotton lashing cords between 22 and 24 inches.

categories.name: Berimbau Replacement Cords: Set of Three

name: Berimbau - Afro-Brazilian Musical Bow by Perere: Gunga / Berraboi
description:
Image of Berimbau - Afro-Brazilian Musical Bow by Pererê - Gunga/Berraboi
$105.00

Handcrafted and unique traditional Afro-Brazilian style musical bow - individually crafted by master craftsman Pererê to sound awesome, look great, and feel balanced and wholesome in the hand. This Berimbau is referred to as a Berraboi or Gunga: It has a large (10 inch diameter) gourd resonator which affords the instrument a deep, loud, and rich bass tone. This Berraboi is finished in a clear lacquer which both protects the instrument & draws out the natural beauty of the materials and is constructed of a resilient hardwood bow properly mated to its calabash (gourd) resonator. This berimbau style averages 61 to 62 inches in length when fully armed and comes complete with split bamboo playing stick (vaqueta), bowstring (corda), fretting stone (moeda), and handwoven caxixi (basket rattle: made of cane & gourd shell).

categories.name: Berimbau - Afro-Brazilian Musical Bow by Pererê: Gunga / Berraboi

name: Berimbau - Afro-Brazilian Musical Bow by Pererê
description: Handcrafted and unique traditional Afro-Brazilian style musical instruments - individually crafted by master craftsman Pererê to sound awesome, look great, and feel balanced and wholesome in the hand. Instruments have been finished in a clear lacquer that draws out the natural beauty of the materials and is constructed of a resilient hardwood bow properly mated to a calabash resonator. This instrument averages 57 to 59 inches (4'9" to 4'11") in length when fully armed and comes complete with playing stick (vaqueta), bowstring (corda), and round rock (moeda), and handwoven caxixi (basket rattle).

categories.name: Berimbau - Afro-Brazilian Musical Bow: Natural Finish

name: Berimbau - Afro-Brazilian Musical Bow by Pererê - Scorched Designs
description:
Handcrafted and unique traditional Afro-Brazilian style musical instruments - individually made by master craftsman Pererê to sound awesome, look great, and feel balanced and wholesome in the hand. This Berimbau offers a gorgeous scorch marked design splashed across the entire length of the berimbau - and then finished in a clear lacquer which both protects the instrument & draws out the beauty of the natural materials. This berimbau is constructed of a resilient hardwood bow with a gourd resonator and averages 58 to 60 inches in length & comes complete with a handwoven caxixi (basket rattle), wooden striker (vaqueta), bowstring (corda), and fretting stone (moeda).

Special Note: Unless otherwise specified by you the scorched designs will be burned over the hardwood's natural color. Colors are available (no extra charge!): blue, dark green, red, purple, brown, burgundy red, brick orange, turquoise, and grey - So contact me if you want some added color to your new berimbau!

options.name: add a single color for no extra cost
